item.title: [Python] Geocoding of postal code
item.description: [Previous paper](http://dx.doi.org/10.4992/jjpsy.87.14075)usedGoogleMapsGeocodingAPItoobtainlatitudeandlongitudecoordinatesfrompostalcode,butotherthanthat,itiscalledHeartRails.However,itprovidesanAPI([HeartRailsGeoAPI](http://geoapi.heartrails.com)) for converting postal code and address data. If you want to use this API from python, you only need the `requests` package and the `json` package. The basic procedure is to set the required parameters in payload and access the API URL with requests.get(). If connected correctly, the result will be returned in json format, so only the necessary parts are extracted. ### sample script import requests import json url ='http://geoapi.
